contentList.content: Fury
You are a furious berserker wielding a weapon in each hand, unleashing a flurry of attacks to carve your opponents to pieces.
Fury Attacks
Your fury knows no bounds. You learn new attacks that expend your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag>.
Rage Becomes Rampage

Your fury becomes so great that you forego <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage during your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag>. But, beginning your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> no longer requires a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>, and all of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag> are regained after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Rampage

Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> turns into a rampage! You don't get <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage, but beginning a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> no longer requires a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>, and all of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag> are regained after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Deals an additional [1] damage with melee and improvised weapons, and when throwing objects.
Single-Minded Fury
Titan's Grip
Bloodthirst
Assault the target in a bloodthirsty craze, restoring [1].
Raging Blow
A mighty blow with both of your weapons.
Wild Strike
A quick strike with your off-hand weapon. After hitting, you can use this attack once more this turn at no resource cost.
You can use Wild Strike once more this turn without expending any resources.
Execute
Attempt to finish off a foe below [2] hit points, dealing an extra [1] damage. If the target dies, you refund the <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charge</LSTag>.
Whirlwind

Unleashes a whirlwind of steel, striking all nearby enemies. Until the end of your next turn, your melee weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attacks</LSTag> can target 1 additional creature within range.
Your melee weapon attacks can target 1 additional creature within range.
Anger Management

While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Raging</LSTag>, whenever you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> on a creature you refund any <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag> spent on the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack</LSTag>.
Reckless Abandon

For the first turn of your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag>, all your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attacks</LSTag> refund any <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag> spent.
This can occur Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Recklessness

Go berserk, immediately activating <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RECKLESS_ATTACK">Reckless Attack</LSTag> and making all your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attacks</LSTag> refund any <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag> spent until the end of your turn.
All your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attacks</LSTag> refund any <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage Charges</LSTag> spent until the end of your turn.
Charge
Charge to an enemy, striking them and possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restraining</LSTag> them for [1] turn(s).
